header.title: K6 Commander
header.startTourTooltip: Take a quick tour of the main features.

tour.step1: Start by entering the full URL of the website or API endpoint you want to test.
tour.step2: Choose which tests to run. You can run a load test, a Lighthouse audit, an AI-powered SEO analysis, or all three at once!
tour.step3: If running a load test, select a pre-configured profile or create your own custom test scenario.
tour.step4: Once you're ready, click here to start the tests. You'll be taken to a new view to monitor the progress.

form.title: New Test Run
form.description: Configure your test parameters below. Start by entering a URL and selecting the test suites to run.
form.urlDescription: The full URL of the website or API endpoint to test.

error.atLeastOne: You must select at least one test suite to run.

form.testSuitesDescription: Select one or more test suites to run against the target URL.
form.k6SwitchDescription: Simulate traffic with k6 to measure backend performance.
form.lighthouseSwitchDescription: Analyze page quality for performance, SEO, and more.
form.seoSwitchDescription: Perform a deep on-page SEO check with AI recommendations.
form.requestConfigDescription: Define the HTTP request details for the load test.
form.loadProfileDescription: Choose a preset or define a custom load profile for the test.
form.customProfileDescription: Fine-tune VUs, duration, or stages for a specific scenario.
form.stagesDescription: Define ramping stages for more complex scenarios. This will override VUs and Duration.

clearHistoryDialog.title: Clear Previous Results?
clearHistoryDialog.description: Starting a new test run can clear your previous test history. Would you like to clear it before starting?

toast.historyClearedDescription: Your previous test history has been cleared.
toast.testStartedDescription: Your test is now running. You will be redirected to the results page upon completion.

running.title: Test in Progress...
running.description: Please wait while the tests are being executed. For load tests, a live Grafana dashboard link will be available.

summary.title: Test Run Complete
summary.description: Results for your test on {{url}} are summarized below.
summary.noK6Data: No k6 load test data available for this run.
summary.noLighthouseData: No Lighthouse audit data available for this run.
summary.noSeoData: No SEO analysis data available for this run.

history.title: Test History
history.description: Review, re-run, or export your past test results.
history.searchPlaceholder: Search by URL or Test ID...
history.noHistoryDescription: Run your first test to see its results here.

clearAllDialog.title: Are you sure you want to delete all history?
clearAllDialog.description: This action cannot be undone. All of your saved test runs and recent URLs will be permanently deleted.

deleteDialog.title: Are you sure?
deleteDialog.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete this test run from your history.

toast.exportSuccessDescription: Your test history has been saved as a JSON file.
toast.exportFailDescription: Could not export history. Please try again.
toast.importFailDescription: Could not import history file. Please check the file format.
toast.deleteSuccessDescription: The test run has been removed from your history.
toast.clearSuccessDescription: All test history and recent URLs have been deleted.

about.title: About K6 Commander
about.description: A lightweight, local-first, authorized load-testing and API development platform. It allows you to configure, run, and analyze load tests, Lighthouse audits, and SEO checks, as well as test APIs with a full-featured client—all from a sleek, responsive web UI.
about.localFirstDescription: Your data is yours. All test configurations, API requests, and results are stored in your browser's LocalStorage, never on our servers.
about.unifiedToolingDescription: Stop juggling multiple apps. Run load tests, Lighthouse audits, SEO checks, and make API calls from a single, cohesive interface.
about.k6FeatureDescription: Harness the power of k6, a modern, open-source load testing tool.
about.k6HowItWorks: K6 Commander spawns a k6 Docker container on-the-fly, configured with your specific test parameters. Metrics are streamed to a local InfluxDB instance and visualized in a pre-configured Grafana dashboard, giving you real-time insights.
about.k6HowItWorks2: After the test, a final JSON summary is saved for historical analysis.
about.lighthouseFeatureDescription: Run Google Lighthouse audits directly from the UI.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks: The backend runs Google Lighthouse using npx, generating both a JSON summary for the UI and a full HTML report. This provides a comprehensive analysis of performance, accessibility, SEO, and best practices.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks2: The detailed HTML report can be opened in a new tab for deep-dive analysis.
about.seoFeatureDescription: Go beyond basic checks with AI-driven on-page SEO analysis.
about.seoHowItWorks: When you run an SEO test, the system fetches your page's raw HTML and sends it to the Google AI Platform via a Genkit flow. The AI analyzes key elements like title tags, meta descriptions, and more, providing actionable recommendations for any issues it finds.
about.seoHowItWorks2: This feature requires a GEMINI_API_KEY in your .env file to function.
about.apiTesterFeatureDescription: A complete environment for testing and debugging APIs.
about.apiTesterHowItWorks: Make GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE requests with custom headers, query parameters, and JSON bodies. Responses are displayed with status, time, and size, with formatted JSON and headers.
about.apiTesterHowItWorks2: All requests are saved to a separate history in LocalStorage, with support for collections and cURL import/export.
about.stackDescription: Built with modern, powerful, and open-source technologies.
about.involvedDescription: K6 Commander is an open-source project. We welcome contributions, bug reports, and feature requests. Check out the project on GitHub to get started!

apiTester.newCollectionDescription: Create a new collection to organize your API requests.

deleteCollectionDialog.title: Delete Collection?
deleteCollectionDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete the '{{name}}' collection and all of its requests? This action cannot be undone.

deleteRequestDialog.title: Delete Request?
deleteRequestDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this request? This action cannot be undone.

apiTester.noRequestsDescription: Your sent requests will appear here.
apiTester.noResponseYetDesc: Send a request to see the response here.

importCurlDialog.title: Import from cURL
importCurlDialog.description: Paste a cURL command below to automatically populate the request fields.

toast.cannotDeleteDefault: The default 'Scratch Pad' collection cannot be deleted.
toast.curlImportErrorDescription: Could not parse the cURL command. Please check the format.
toast.curlImportSuccessDescription: The request has been populated from the cURL command.
toast.jsonFormatErrorDescription: The content of the body is not valid JSON.
toast.apiCurlCopiedDescription: The cURL command has been copied to your clipboard.
toast.curlCopyInvalidUrl: Please enter a valid URL before copying as cURL.
